creator: Bryce, George, 1844-1931. (author)
Bell, Charles Napier, 1854-1936. (author)
description: Bryce, George: 1844-1931. Born at Mount Pleasant, Upper Canada; educated at University of Toronto; ordained a Presbyterian minister, 1871, and immediately sent to Winnipeg to organize work of Presbyterian Church; founded Manitoba College, and played part in founding of University of Manitoba; elected member Royal Society of Canada, 1901; moderator of Presbyterian Church in Canada, 1902; avid historian and writer (Wallace, Dictionary of Canadian biography). // Bell, Charles Napier: 1854-1936. From Ontario to Fort Garry as member of Wolseley expedition, fall 1870; after a year in Customs Department made hunting expedition in upper Saskatchewan region, summer 1872; customs clerk, 1874-1881; customs clerk with CPR, 1881-1886; secretary of Winnipeg Grain Exchange, 1887-1916; secretary-treasurer and later treasurer of Winnipeg Board of Trade, 1887-1919; active member of Historical and Scientific Society of Manitoba and other scientific societies (Winnipeg Free Press, August 3, 1936). // Text in double columns. Caption title: "Pages from the past: Some letters of Lord Selkirk hitherto unpublished, and some of the early laws of the Settlement."
